club.name: Space Technologies at Cal
club.mission: Creating A Multi-Campus Initiative To Advance Space Technology
club.mission-short: We Work to Push And Innovate Space Technology
club.description:
We are a group of passionate scientists who want to push the frontier of space research and the space industry. We are not a typical engineering club that focuses on a set competition but rather we focus on making strides in innovating space technologies.
We are currently pursuing this goal by working to enable life beyond our Earth. With projects ranging from a 3U CubeSat Deployer of smaller PCBSats, launching Microgravity Experiments with a wide variety of research experiments inside, a High Altitude Balloon program, a BioSphere project to work on implications of life off earth, and even an Autonomous Resource Rover to explore rover designs, make it ISRU capable and autonomous.
Our innovation in space technologies is a multi-campus and industry-wide effort. Current partners include UC Santa Barbara (PCBSat development), and UC Berkeley Space Science Laboratory (vibration and vacuum testing), and NASA Ames (rover design). STAC provides a platform for these groups to collaborate and make strides in far reaching technology that is also connected to major problems in the space industry today.
club.ocf-disclaimer: We are a student group acting independently of the University of California. We take full responsibility for our organization and this web site.

example.title: Example Project
example.blog-title: An amazing title gets lots of attention

team.title: Team
team.section: The people who made it happen...

member.name: Travis Brashears
member.title: Co-Founder & Co-President & Engineering Design Lead
member.bio: Space exploration offers humans a means of striving for something greater far beyond Earth, so I have dedicated the past 4 years of my life to exploring the possibilities of innovations in technology for space. I believe there comes a time when you have to start changing the world, otherwise the world will change without you. This is why we started STAC.

member.name: Olivia Hsu
member.title: Co-Founder & Co-President & Electronics Lead
member.bio: Space is an area of limitless possibilities and unchartered territory that not only inspires innovative technology but also excites creative ideas. Humans have the opportunity to learn new information through space exploration and research, which is why I’ve spent time working at NASA and would like to study space even further through STAC.

member.name: Gan Tu
member.title: Co-founder & Software Expert & Graphic Design
member.bio: I have a tremendous passion for learning cross disciplinary subjects. Motivated by my relentless intellectual curiosity, I make efforts to acquire skills and insights in education, law, business, engineering, and design etc. I have lead and taken roles in several award winning projects with these skills, and I am excited to leverage all these experiences to explore the space, which first inspired my learning journey.

member.name: Camille Stuczynski
member.title: Internal Vice President
member.bio: I'm pursuing excellence in engineering management. The STAC team is incredibly passionate and innovative. I am so excited to do anything I can to further our discovery in space technology. I am heavily involved in the logistics, recruiting, and financing of multiple engineering teams and research projects, and hope to turn those skills into a career in furthering science and engineering.

member.name: Malhar Patel
member.title: External Vice President
member.bio: I became interested in space after debating space policy my freshman year of high school. There has been a huge resurgence in space research within the past few years and I strive to apply AI to the next frontier. Space is no longer the abstract concept that people believe is out of reach; it's a place where we can have a positive impact.

member.name: Philipp Wu
member.title: Engineering Director
member.bio: I love to learn and there is nothing more prodigious than exploring the depths of space. Growing up next to JPL, space research has always been part of my life. Design is also something that has always been important to me and the projects at STAC allow for us to help aid the human effort in space exploration in a variety of areas. I hope to learn as much as I can. As the writer Brandon Sanderson says, “Journey before Destination.

member.name: Daniel Shen
member.title: TIME Project Lead
member.bio: I have diverse interests from space exploration to organic chemistry. I spend much of my time at the UC Berkeley Radio Astronomy Lab working on the HYPERION project probing signals from the Epoch of Reionization. I also enjoy competitive ballroom dance and cooking - perhaps the only thing more vast than the cosmos is the myriad of slow cooker recipes the internet has to offer.

member.name: Sepehr Rostamzadeh
member.title: Autonomous Rover Project Lead
member.bio: I’ve been interested in space exploration and experimentation ever since I learned about the possibility of life outside of Earth. I hope to utilize my experiences from working in Pieter Abbeel’s AI Robotics Lab and in Aerospace SAE to help design for the various projects in which STAC will participate. I’m extremely excited to see what this group of bright, passionate engineers can accomplish!

member.name: Varun Khurana
member.title: CubeSat Deployer Project Lead
member.bio: Space instills unbridled curiosity because there's just so much that we don't know about it, and this type of curiosity has been fueling me to learn for many years in areas ranging from space to mathematics and engineering.

member.name: Abhishyant Khare
member.title: High Altitude Ballon Project Lead
member.bio: I have been interested in space ever since I started watching Futurama as a kid, and firmly believe that humanity will settle beyond Earth in our lifetime. I study engineering so that I can be a part of that great endeavour in any way I can.

member.name: Daniel Sotsaikich
member.title: TIME-2 Project Lead
member.bio: I want to put all of my education and engineering skills towards extending the limits of human knowledge and innovation. I am extremely curious about what is out there in space and am so grateful that I found STAC, where I can fully unleash my ambition working with the most brilliant people I know.

member.name: William Sharpless
member.title: Biosphere Project Lead
member.bio: Space is the gate to our future, holding answers to our earthly troubles and greater questions for us to explore. My biggest question is how can life exist in space, or on other planets? I seek to discover how we can spread and grow life beyond our little home.

member.name: Anoushka Giri
member.title: Engineering Officer
member.bio: Space is often looked at as where our future is heading, but I don't think many people realize how much of it is already a part of what we do. From the incredible span of NASA spinoffs to the new modes of industry it allows for, space is the motivation that has pushed us there. I know space technology will only continue to set off even meow chain reactions that go on to help everyone, and I hope to let our world appreciate and get involved with it more!

member.name: Victoria Yim
member.title: Social Officer
member.bio: When I was younger, space and space travel terrified me; even the experts knew so little about about it and that deeply worried me. As I grew older, I started to learn more about what we didn't know yet and my fear turned into curiosity. Now, the unknown quality of space is what fuels me to discover what it truly is and how humans will get there.

member.name: Ravi Dashputre
member.title: Outreach Officer
member.bio: The future of humanity is written in the stars. The next big step in our evolution is reaching beyond our world to others unknown. I want to do everything that I can to help us get to closer to knowing more about the universe. There are untold wonders out there to be found!

member.name: Sarah Truong
member.title: Internal Officer
member.bio: After watching Star Wars and Star Trek ritually when I was a young kid, my passion for space and astronomy grew. Encoded within me is an innate desire to determine the purpose of all things, including all components of human life and the universe. This drives me to help STAC accomplish its mission today in hopes that we can add further value to the study of the final frontier.

member.name: James Mang
member.title: Financial Officer
member.bio: I have always had a passion for space since I was a child. For me, space is the future and space is the ultimate destination for humanity. The innovations that come from space exploration just blows my mind and makes me profound at what we can achieve. There is so much in space that we don't understand and I want to be able to discover these unknowns myself.

member.name: Namrita Baru
member.title: Software Expert
member.bio: My passion for space began in 2nd grade with my admiration and respect for my female role model in STEM: Sally Ride, the first American woman in space. Space specifically fascinates me because there is so much research and science to develop to aid us in exploring and learning about what the universe has to offer. Exploring the unknown, and being able to do that with so many degrees of freedom, is why I'm interested in space.

member.name: Aviral Pandey
member.title: Electrical Expert
member.bio: I enjoy working on electronics projects, and electronics for space present some unique challenges not found elsewhere. The STAC team offers me an opportunity to find solutions to these challenges while working with a unique, motivated, and outstanding group of individuals.

member.name: Brent Yi
member.title: Electrical Expert
member.bio: I'm an amateur space enthusiast here at Berkeley. I really enjoy designing stuff, and am super pumped to be a part of STAC!

member.name: Emily Stednitz
member.title: Mechanical Expert
member.bio: I am passionate about shaping our future in space and working on projects that really matter. The opportunities for space exploration are boundless and offer unique challenges. Hands-on learning is my favorite building and testing is what I love most. I have experience in a variety of disciplines including product design and flight controls engineering, and I also carry a private pilot license.

member.name: Albert Li
member.title: Autonomous Rover Project Member
member.bio: I have a lot of passion for design. I’m extremely interested to see how engineering in space changes in the coming future and am excited to contribute to the advancement of our understanding of the great unknown. STAC has been a great organization that has bolstered my creativity and helped me foster closer relationships with my teammates. I look forward to exploring space with them!

member.name: Kireet Agrawal
member.title: High Altitude Ballon Project Member
member.bio: After countless trips to Kennedy space center and seeing the direct impact of innovations for the final frontier, I've been enthralled with space. I love the challenging atmosphere that surrounds technology in space. I love making wide variety of things and am currently focusing on the intersection of software, electronics and mechanical design.

member.name: Junhao Yu
member.title: CubeSat Deployer Project Member
member.bio: I’m a freshman in Physics and I hold strong interests in the space. I am heavily involved in physics theories and get trained in designed. With science and passion, human beings start with nothing and build the whole civilized world, so shall we today. I’m eager to do my best achieving each step of exploring the space with my passionate and outstanding teammates.

sponsor.title: Our Sponsors
sponsor.section1-heading: The sponsors and partners who support us
section1-description: Thanks to all of our current sponsors and partners!
Their support ensures that we can continue innovating and breaking through new barriers in space.
sponsor.section2-description: If you are interested in shaping the coming age of space exploration along our side with a sponsorship or donation, please contact us at
sponsor.section3-description: Learn what we offer to our sponsors and partners
sponsor.section3-text: By siging up, we will keep your information strictly confidential.
sponsor.mailing-list-success-msg: Thanks for your submission, we will be in touch shortly.

sponsor-confirmation.title: Sponsorship Package Download Page
confirmation-text: Please let us know if you have any questions!
We will keep you updated on our latest project and sponsorship updates.
